content: arrangement should be 26 heel +gusset stitches on needle 1 32 instep stitches on needle 2 and 26 heel+gusset stitches on needle 3 magic loop place all your instep stitches on needle 1 place your heel and gusset stitches on needle 2 your beginning of round will be in the middle of needle 2- awkward we know but it s easier to track your decreases row 10 knit all stitches row 11 knit to 3 stitches before your instep needle k2tog k1 knit across instep stitches k1 ssk knit to end of round 2 stitches decreased repeat row 10 and 11 until you have a total of 64 stitches across all your needles your stitches should naturally be arranged as follows dpns 16 stitches on needle 1 32 instep stitches on needle 2 and 16 stitches on needle 3 magic loop 32 instep stitches on needle 1 32 stitches on needle 2 foot knit plain until the sock reaches the right length for your foot we recommend trying your sock on as you go when the sock reaches the base of your big toe you re ready to start your toe toe from now until the end of the sock you will knit across the top of the foot corresponding to your instep and then the underside of the foot for each round arrange your stitches and bor marker for the toe as follows dpns knit across needle 2 move your bor marker to the beginning of needle 2 you will now knit in this order needle 2 needle 3 needle 1 magic loop move your bor marker to the beginning of needle 1 you will now knit in this order needle 1 needle 2 row 12 *k1 ssk knit across top of toe until 3 stitches remain k2tog k1* repeat from * to * once more for underside of toe 4 stitches decreased 5 row 13 knit all stitches repeat row 12 and 13 until you have a total of 32 stitches across all your needles your stitches should naturally be arranged as follows dpns 16 stitches on needle 2 8 stitches each on needle 3 and needle 1 magic loop 16 stitches on needle 1 16 stitches on needle 2 if using dpns slide the stitches from needle 1 onto needle 3 so that you have 16 stitches on needle 2 across top of toe and 16 stitches on needle 3 across bottom of foot using the kitchener stitch graft the end of your toe together repeat instructions for the second sock weave in your ends and you re done be sure to tag us on instagram @fabricationsott and wear them next time you re in the shop 6 irish chain quilt socks chart 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 a 1 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 b 1
